intro: Montanoa pringlei, commonly known as the Mexican sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, bright orange to red composite flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Its leaves are usually alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and often branched. Montanoa pringlei is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
